item.description:
Hi Everyone,

The weather has to be good enough to make this attack run a successful one !

Its looking good to Kick Rambo's ass into the water and for us to take the beach this weekend.

This is an alternate way to reach  John J. RAMBO's Island of DOOM for us to make a flank beach am-bush and for us to use the sand beach this time instead of the Stoned Rocky Balboa Island nearby as we have in the past.

CHART: http://photos2.meetupstatic.com/photos/event/9/c/5/6/highres_127300022.jpeg

 

There are a few isolated Enemy Island Command Outposts to explore before we make our final advance on the beach and kick sand onto Rambo's whimpy beach blanket.

Some machine gun toting PT boats and some Cong Boats will be in the channel where we have to sneak between them prior to the Island approach (Don't Worry--they wont even see us) so when its time, paddle fast like the way you would if the Grinning Banjo Boys were behind you with one hand ready on the throttle and the other hand soaking in a bucket of PIG FAT..

Tides:.. Dosen't matter since we are going whether high or low

Aiir: http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KGON&state=CT

Weather, Sea: http://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lat=41.317270643642104&lon=-71.99752807617188&site=okx&unit=0&lg=en&FcstType=text

 

 

" Uhhh Look--What The Weather ? ..Yeah -- Them Fools are going to Kick Sand onto my Beach Blanket ??? -- Im going to make it rain Bullets if they try"..

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

--------------

Driving and parking Directions:

APPROXIMATE GPS #: 937 Groton Long Point Road  Groton, CT 06340

USE THE MEETUP* MAP LINK AT THE TOP OF THIS PAGE FOR YOUR SPECIFIC DIRECTIONS

General Details of the put in area:

http://www.lisrc.uconn.edu/coastalaccess/sitephoto.asp?siteid=478

From I-95 N & S:

Take Exit # 88 - go South on Route 117.

Left onto Route 1. At top of hill bear right onto Route 215 South.

Easker Point Beach is approximately 1.5 miles down on the left, the parking lot is on the RIGHT (its before the Fisherman's Restaurant).

A small carry in boat launch located off the parking lot, (it is sort of behind the Fisherman restaurant), it gives access to Plam Slapping, High Fiving Palmer’s Cove for a five fingers up warm up paddle then we Cross under the bridge to begin the attack run.

We will stay till the JOB is done on the beach and the nearby water -- then the survivors will head back for the Celebratory Victory BBQ.

-------------------

The after paddling Potluck BBQ is either ON site NEAR our parking area if its nice enough -or- the alternate unique location inside the stone ruins of Haley Farm buildings nearby (http://www.lisrc.uconn.edu/coastalaccess/site.asp?siteid=459).

Final BBQ Location is To be decided upon when loading up the yaks..

-----------------------------------------------------

KAYAKS AVAILABLE:

The following Kayaks with paddles and life jackets are available for the put in site if reserved in advance:

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event, these are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please get a GPS, or a GPS with traffic data is even better.

 

 

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00.

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 240 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

AVAILABLE

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.    http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706

AVAILABLE

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

RESERVED FOR MARY BETH

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 175 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

RESERVED FOR MARSHA



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 150 - 220 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

RESERVED FOR KAT

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (150-180 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

RESERVED FOR AL_R

 

............................................................................

 

Please DO NOT USE THE COMMENT SECTION BELOW FOR  ANNOYING CHATTER COMMENTS like all those

"OTHER" Meetup groups do (after getting 20-30 comment e mails form each different group. its annoying) ..

HOWEVER, ONLY GOOD PERTINENT ONES RELATING TO THIS EVENT DIRECTLY ARE FINE but you can also do that in your RSVP area..

 

We will see those that are interested.

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: Look for me waering my ORANGE RAMBO Hunting Hat @ PARKING /CARRY IN RAMP Area

item.name: JUN 9-John J. RAMBO's IsL Am-Bush via Operation Easker's Pt - Potluck BBQ Nearby
